question:
Your goal is to make the expression number == numberFromList true. What is yourAnswer value?\n
var list = [1,3,5,7,9,11]\n
var number = 9\n
list.remove(at: 3)\n
var numberFromList = list[yourAnswer]\n
feedback: In this challenge you had to figure out which would be number 9’s index after the original array was modified. In Swift, the index of an array’s first element is 0, not 1. At first, as the number 9 was in the fifth position, its index was 4. However, on the third line, we removed the element whose index was 3 (which means we removed the item located in the forth position: the number 7). That way, our new array list is [1,3,5,9,11]. Now, the number 9 is in the forth position and its new index is 3.

question: Below we have 3 functions. Find out whether any of them contains an error and drag each function tag into the proper field. \n
example_code:
func printEvenNumbers(_ n: Int) {\n
    \t var n = n \n
    \t for number in 0...n { \n
        \t\t if number % 2 == 0 { \n
            \t\t\t print(number) \n
        \t\t } \n
    \t }\n
}\n\n

func sevenTimesTable(n: Double) -> String {\n

    \t var number = n \n
    \t let multiplier = 7 \n
    \t var result = number * multiplier \n

    \t return "\(number) * 7 = \(result)" \n
} \n\n


func partsOfDay(time: Int) -> String { \n
    \t var time = 0 \n
    \t var periodName = "" \n

    \t switch time { \n
    \t\t case 5..<17: \n
        \t\t\t periodName = "morning or afternoon" \n
     \t\t case 17..<5: \n
        \t\t\t periodName = "evening or night" \n
    \t}\n
    \treturn periodName \n
}

question:
In this challenge, we will give movement instructions to Manny, the robot. You will have to figure out where it is located after the commands have been executed.

Below we have the image of part of a grid. Each square can be referred to through a tuple (x,y).
Manny is placed at the grid. Right now, var robotPosition = (x: 3, y: 1)

The robot responds to only 3 commands:
R: turn right
L: turn left
A: advance
Notice: The robot only changes its current square with the command A!

We will give the following instructions to Manny: RALAALAAR

Which option is correct regarding the robot's final position?
By the end of this code, what names will be contained in the array names?
